Instance.description: Pick up an existing object using the posture system.

TunableTuple.name: no_content
TunableTuple.description: Do not animate or stage in this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: allow_holster
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an override as to whether or not this interaction allows holstering. If left unspecified, then only staging interactions will allow holstering. For example: a one-shot interaction where the Grim Reaper dooms a Sim disallows carry. Normally, the Grim Reaper would be unable to holster his scythe. We override holstering to be allowed such that the scythe can indeed be holstered.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Whether or not holstering is explicitly allowed or not.

TunableVariant.name: allow_with_unholsterable_object
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an override to the default behavior for this interaction when carrying an object that is tuned to be unholsterable (e.g. a toddler or a puppy). By default: * Mixer interactions have this set to True. So, unless overridden, a mixer is allowed to execute normally when carrying an unholsterable object. The Sim will continue the carry and execute the mixer. If unchecked, the Sim will put the object down before running the mixer. * Super interactions have this set to False. So, unless overridden, a super interaction is not allowed to execute (or will cancel the carry) when carrying an unholsterable object. e.g. * Warm Hands at Fireplace. This is a super interaction. When carrying a toddler, for example, we want to the Sim to execute the interaction and mask the animation. So we override this value and set it to True. * Tell Joke about Fashion. This is a mixer interaction whose animation does not read if unable to use the hands. We override this so Sims put down toddlers before running it.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Whether or not this interaction is allowed to execute when carrying an incompatible, unholsterable object.

TunableVariant.name: link_carried_sims
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this interaction will push a CARRIED_SIM_PROXY_AFFORDANCE on sims who are being carried on the actor or target. They will be linked such that cancelling either the wait interaction on the carried sims or this original interaction will cancel every other linked interaction. If tests are tuned, then we will only do this if they pass. If none are tuned, then we always link.

TdescFragTag.name: enabled
TdescFragTag.description: If any tests are tuned, we will only link carried sims if they pass.

TunableVariant.name: route_to_location
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will force the Sim to route to a particular set of constraints. This will occur between the animation's begin and end states.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: An element that will route a Sim to a particular location when it runs.

TunableList.name: route_constraints
TunableList.description: A list of constraints and the participant they are relative to that the Sim will route to fulfill when this element runs.

TunableList.name: constraints
TunableList.description: Constraints relative to the relative participant.

Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid." group="General">

TunableTuple.description: A non-looping animation reference.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, Back, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the 'props' field, the data inside 'props' will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite. If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override. If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

TunableVariant.name: object_by_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, select the object based on a participant type.

TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_object_based_on_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define a relationship between the participant and a replacement prop. We use this during proposals to swap the ring prop from the picker object (a ring on a stand) to tuned object (a ring without the stand). This tuning will be ignored if object_by_participant already tuned.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the participant and give a list of objects and the replacement prop each one of the objects relates to.

TunableVariant.name: from_participant
TunableVariant.description: The participant to copy the state over

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant type that will be used to get the participant that will provide the override value.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableVariant.name: reactionlet
TunableVariant.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override. If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

TunableVariant.name: object_by_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, select the object based on a participant type.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_object_based_on_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define a relationship between the participant and a replacement prop. We use this during proposals to swap the ring prop from the picker object (a ring on a stand) to tuned object (a ring without the stand). This tuning will be ignored if object_by_participant already tuned.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the participant and give a list of objects and the replacement prop each one of the objects relates to.

TunableEnum.name: participant

TunableList.description: A mapping of participant object to the new replacement prop.

TunableEnum.name: enabled

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description: Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty. For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, Back, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableVariant.name: link_carried_sims
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this interaction will push a CARRIED_SIM_PROXY_AFFORDANCE on sims who are being carried on the actor or target. They will be linked such that cancelling either the wait interaction on the carried sims or this original interaction will cancel every other linked interaction. If tests are tuned, then we will only do this if they pass. If none are tuned, then we always link.

TdescFragTag.name: enabled
TdescFragTag.description: If any tests are tuned, we will only link carried sims if they pass.

TunableVariant.name: periodic_stat_change
TunableVariant.description: Statistic changes tuned to occur every specified interval.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A repeating variant of PeriodicStatisticChangeElement that triggers after each interval.

TunableList.name: actions
TunableList.description: A list of actions that occur at each interval

Tunable.name: alarm_interval
Tunable.description: Interval in sim minutes that applies operations if operation is not a statistic change operation on a continious statistic and not a skill loot operation. Example: If buff loot is in the operation list and this is set to 5. Loot op will try to be applied every 5 sim minutes the sim is in the interaction. Another example when this is used: - Statistic Change Op on statistic_GameForever If there is a statistic in operation is continuous the alarm interval is not used, examples are below. - Statistic Change Op on motive_hunger - Dynamic skill on statistic_Skill_AdultMajor_Piano

TunableList.name: operations
TunableList.description: A list of statistic operations that occur at each interval.

TunableVariant.description: A variant of statistic operations.

TunableTuple.name: dynamic_skill
TunableTuple.description: DynamicSkillLootOp is used to tune a skill gain. You get different amounts of skill based on your current skill level. The amount comes from the curve in the Skill Loot Data Override->Effectiveness. Super Interaction, Mixer Interaction, and Recipe can override specific fields for DynamicSkillLootOp using a field called 'Skill Loot Data' The Overrides are prioritized in this order: 1. Dynamic Skill Loot Tuning 2. Mixer Interaction - Skill Loot Data 3. Super Interaction - Skill Loot Data 4. Recipe - Skill Loot Data Examples: 1. The most common use of overrides is to use the same Dynamic Skill Loot on multiple interactions, and then setting the stat in the Skill Loot Data of the interaction. This lets you use the same loot for different skills. 2. Level Range lets you cap the min or max amount of skill gain. You get a DynamicSkillLootOp for your fitness which is at level 2. We look up level 2 in Skill/Skill Effectiveness Gain but it only has tuning level 5 to 8. We then clamp 2 up to 5 and get the skill gain for level 5 and pay out that skill. If your skill was level 9 you would have been clamped down to the skill gain at level 8. 3. If we setup tuning like this: Recipe -> Super Interaction -> Mixer Interaction -> DynamicSkillLootOp With: DynamicSkillLootOp - Skill Loot Data Override ( Effectiveness STANDARD ) Mixer Interaction - Skill Loot Data( Effectiveness Huge ) Super Interaction - Skill Loot Data( Stat: Fitness ) Recipe - Skill Loot Data( Stat: Cooking ) In this example you would gain: STANDARD Skill Gain for the Fitness Stat.

Tunable.name: exclusive_to_owning_si
Tunable.description: If enabled, this gain will be exclusive to the SI that created it and will not be allowed to occur if the sim is running mixers from a different SI. If disabled, this gain will happen as long as this SI is active, regardless of which SI owns the mixer the sim is currently running. This is only effective on Sims.

TunableTuple.name: skill_loot_data_override
TunableTuple.description: This data will override loot data in the interaction. In interaction, tuning field 'skill_loot_data' is used to determine skill loot data.

TunableEnum.name: effectiveness
TunableEnum.description: Enum to determine which curve to use when giving points to sim.

TunableVariant.name: level_range
TunableVariant.description: Interval is used to clamp the sim's user facing skill level to determine how many point to give. If disabled, level passed to the dynamic skill loot will always be the current user facing skill level of sim. Example: if sim is level 7 in fitness but interaction skill level is only for 1 to 5 give the dynamic skill amount as if sim is level 5.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Interval is used to clamp the sim's user facing skill level to determine how many point to give. If disabled, level passed to the dynamic skill loot will always be the current user facing skill level of sim. Example: if sim is level 7 in fitness but interaction skill level is only for 1 to 5 give the dynamic skill amount as if sim is level 5.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.description: An alternative version of the DynamicSkillLootOp that grabs the skill from something other than a reference to a statistic. It is currently designed to be used as a LootAction only, meaning that it does not get tuned directly on Interactions, Recipes, etc. like DynamicSkillLootOp does.

TunableVariant.name: maximum
TunableVariant.description: A variant containing the different ways you can cap the max amount a statistic reaches as result of a change.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: The max amount of points that a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_points
Tunable.description: The point total that a stat cannot go above when increasing. If the increase would go above this point total, instead it will just be equal to this point total.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: The max rank a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_rank
Tunable.description: The rank that a stat cannot go beyond when increasing. If the increase would go beyond achieving this rank, instead it will be set to the min points required to meet this rank. This will prevent any gains toward the next rank from occurring. NOTE: Must be used with a RankedStatistic or it will return 0 as the max.

TunableVariant.name: object_cost_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to multiply the stat gain amount based on the value of the object specified.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on the value/cost of an object.

TunableList.name: multiplier_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The value of the subject in simoleons is used. This means that a curve for cost should have value at its x-axis.

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description: When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins. Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance. IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time. Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point. RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior. APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

TunableList.name: value_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The user-value is used. This means that a curve for skills should have levels as its x-axis.

TunableList.description: The owner of the stat that we are operating on.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableEnum.name: transfer_type
TunableEnum.description: Type of statistic transfer to use.

TunableVariant.name: transfer_type_average_advanced
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the average calculation will be the sum of multiplying the stat value and stat quantity then dividing with total quantity. T = Transferred Stat value S = Stat value QT = Quantity Transferred Stat value QS = Quantity Stat value Result = ((T * QT) + (S * QS)) / (QT + QS) If disabled, the result will calculate Mean of 2 stat values. Result = (T + S) / 2

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Statistic quantities for both subject and donor.

Tunable.name: quantity_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity subject which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: quantity_transferred_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity donor which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: transferred_stat
Tunable.description: The statistic whose value to transfer.

Tunable.name: suppress_skill_bars
Tunable.description: Whether or not to suppress any skill bars.

Tunable.name: trigger_gain_on_start
Tunable.description: If checked then we will trigger a statistic gain when we start the statistic gains. This is to make sure that things like upgrades will have some statistic progress when the sim is charged for the upgrade instead of loosing the payment.

TunableVariant.name: route_to_location
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will force the Sim to route to a particular set of constraints. This will occur between the animation's begin and end states.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: An element that will route a Sim to a particular location when it runs.

TunableList.name: route_constraints
TunableList.description: A list of constraints and the participant they are relative to that the Sim will route to fulfill when this element runs.

TunableList.name: constraints
TunableList.description: Constraints relative to the relative participant.

TunableTuple.TunableList:
<TunableVariant type="None" name="max_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Max Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid." group="General">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="min_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Min Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid." group="General">

TunableTuple.name: water_depth_interval
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Test if a Sim should be walking, wading or swimming based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

TunableEnum.name: relative_participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant tuned here will have this constraint applied to them.

Tunable.name: si_to_push
Tunable.description: SI to push after picking up the object.
